author: @eldeber
title: Supercl√°sico Boca-River, el gran duelo del f√∫tbol argentino el fin de semana | El Deber
text: Supercl√°sico Boca-River, el gran duelo del f√∫tbol argentino el fin de semana El encuentro se jugar√° este s√°bado, a partir de las 15:00, en La Bombonera. Corresponde a la fecha 15 de la liga profesional Protagonistas de una rivalidad centenaria y cargada de cruces hist√≥ricos, Boca Juniors y River Plate animar√°n este s√°bado otro episodio del Supercl√°sico del f√∫tbol argentino en La Bombonera, en la decimoquinta fecha de la liga profesional. El duelo entre los clubes m√°s populares de Argentina encuentra a los rivales eternos igualados en la tabla de posiciones con 21 puntos y lejos del puntero V√©lez (30), aunque el clima es muy distinto de un lado y del otro. Boca, el local, viene de perder un cl√°sico contra Racing (2-1) que volvi√≥ a dejarlo lejos de los primeros puestos, inmerso en una campa√±a irregular, en la que el entrenador Diego Mart√≠nez se ha quedado con poco cr√©dito, por lo que un triunfo puede hacerle recuperar apoyo, pero una ca√≠da en La Bombonera tendr√≠a un costo muy duro para su continuidad. El equipo azul y oro se muestra muy fuerte en su estadio, donde gan√≥ 13 de sus √∫ltimos 17 partidos, pero disminuye notoriamente su juego fuera de casa, con tres meses sin victorias como visitante (cuatro empates y cuatro derrotas) en las √∫ltimas salidas de su casa. Eliminado prematuramente de la Copa Sudamericana en octavos de final, al Xeneize s√≥lo le quedan por delante la Liga y la Copa Argentina como √∫ltimas opciones para festejar y conseguir la clasificaci√≥n a la pr√≥xima Copa Libertadores. En cambio, River est√° en los cuartos de final de la Libertadores, liderado por Marcelo Gallardo y con perspectivas de seguir en carrera luego de rescatar un empate 1-1 en la visita a Colo Colo de Chile. - River alerta - El supercl√°sico encuentra al Millonario medio de una serie copera con expectativas de lograr la clasificaci√≥n a las semifinales en el desquite que se jugar√° el martes en el Monumental de Buenos Aires. Pero, mientras tanto, Gallardo no quiere descuidar el duelo contra el archienemigo, con la certeza de que una victoria a domicilio le puede dar un impulso enorme de cara a la recta final del campeonato. Muy posiblemente el DT deba hacer cambios para jugar en La Bombonera, ya que Maxi Meza padece una lesi√≥n muscular, y tambi√©n debe evaluar qu√© otros jugadores debe preservar para el desquite contra Colo Colo, que llegar√° apenas 72 horas despu√©s del supercl√°sico. El historial global entre Boca y River por la Liga local registra 262 cotejos, con 92 triunfos para los Xeneizes, 86 para los Millonarios y 84 empates. El √∫ltimo choque fue en abril pasado, por los cuartos de final de la Copa de la Liga, con triunfo de los auriazules (3-2) en C√≥rdoba. El Supercl√°sico se jugar√° el s√°bado desde las 15:00 (HB), como eje central de una jornada que arrancar√° el viernes con Gimnasia-Riestra y Uni√≥n-Godoy Cruz, y seguir√° despu√©s del supercl√°sico en la noche del s√°bado con Instituto-Barracas, Newell‚Äôs-Tigre y Defensa-San Lorenzo. El domingo jugar√°n Hurac√°n-Lan√∫s, Independiente-Argentinos, Talleres-Racing, Atl√©tico Tucum√°n-Belgrano y Platense-Rosario Central, mientras que el lunes completar√°n Sarmiento-Central C√≥rdoba, Banfield-Independiente Rivadavia y V√©lez, el puntero, contra Estudiantes.

author: Click4r Solutions Private Limited
title: Exploring the Depths: Wonders You‚Äôll Encounter as the Oceanograp | Click4R
text: By the vibrant environments of coral reefs to the unexplainable depths of the abyss, oceanography gives an extraordinary peek into the magic of our planet's largest habitat. Since you dive straight into the world associated with oceanography, you can find yourself surrounded by breathtaking marine biodiversity and astonishing geological formations. Each journey takes you deeper underneath the waves, exposing a concealed realm wherever incredible species flourish and unique organic phenomena abound. As a great oceanographer, you may be in the frontline associated with exploration, uncovering the secrets of the underwater world. From the smallest phytoplankton that form the foundation of the ocean food web to majestic whales sliding through the open up ocean, the selection of life you will encounter is nothing short associated with remarkable. With every single research mission, you will witness the particular dynamic interplay associated with ocean currents, trail the impact regarding climate change about marine ecosystems, and even explore the stunning beauty of underwater landscapes, making just about every journey an experience stuffed with discovery. Incredible Underwater Kinds Being an oceanographer, you will have typically the privilege of encountering a staggering array of marine life, each more fascinating than the last. From the vibrant colors associated with tropical fish darting through coral reefs to the enigmatic dance of bioluminescent organisms in the deep sea, the particular diversity of water species is really incredible. Some of these types of creatures, like the majestic manta beam and the evasive seahorse, tell people stories of adaptation and survival in their unique environments. Observing these types in their organic habitats provides essential insights into their own behaviors and functions inside the ecosystem. Among the particular incredible marine kinds you may come across are the soft giants of the ocean, for example whales and dolphins. These intelligent creatures demonstrate complex social manners and communications of which oceanographers study to understand their effect on marine ecology. Furthermore, the ocean is home to remarkable predators just like the great white shark and the colossal squid, whose modifications for hunting plus survival challenge each of our perceptions of marine life. Witnessing these animals in action underscores the importance associated with ocean conservation in addition to the delicate stability within marine ecosystems. Throughout contrasting environments, oceanographers also explore the microcosm of existence found in the world of phytoplankton. These incredibly tiny organisms form the particular foundation of the oceanic food web plus are crucial with regard to oxygen production. Studying phytoplankton not simply discloses the sheer size of life in the oceans but in addition highlights the interconnectedness of all marine species. The magic of oceanography in the end lie in the myriad of species that call typically the sea home, every single contributing to the intricate tapestry regarding life beneath typically the waves. Underwater Phenomena The most fascinating underwater phenomena oceanographers encounter is bioluminescence. This sun light, produced by various ocean organisms such as jellyfish and particular sorts of plankton, creates a stunning stage show in the black depths of typically the ocean. As oceanographers study these bioluminescent species, they uncover insights into their behaviors, communication methods, and ecological roles. Experiencing a glowing under the sea scene is truly a wonder that leaves some sort of lasting impression. Tidal new trends are another fascinating aspect of oceanography, specially the intricate styles produced by the gravitational pull of typically the moon and sunlight. Oceanographers analyze tides through sophisticated designs, observing how they will affect coastal ecosystems and marine existence. The rhythmic surge and fall regarding sea levels may reveal a wealth of details about the interconnectivity in the ocean in addition to environment, illustrating how everything is intricately linked. Additionally, oceanographers analysis underwater currents and gyres, which have fun with an essential role throughout regulating global weather and marine biodiversity. By tracking Blane Peruns TheSea.Org of movements, scientists may gauge the well being of marine ecosystems and the influence of climate alter. Exploring these currents often leads to be able to unexpected discoveries, such as the alpage patterns of sea species and typically the distribution of nutrients that influence numerous habitats, making each expedition an experience full of amazed. Special Ocean Ecosystems Oceanography unveils a variety associated with unique ecosystems, every with its unique characteristics and inhabitants. One of the most vibrant cases is the coral reefs reef ecosystem. Coral formations reefs, often known to as typically the " rainforests involving the sea, " are teeming together with life. They supply habitat and shelter intended for countless species, which include colorful fish, mollusks, and crustaceans. Oceanographers study these environments to understand typically the intricate relationships involving marine organisms and exactly how they contribute to biodiversity. Another fascinating environment could be the deep-sea hydrothermal vent community. Present along mid-ocean side rails, these vents are usually characterized by extreme conditions, which includes high temperatures and even pressure. Here, exclusive organisms like pipe worms, giant clams, and chemosynthetic bacterias thrive, relying in chemicals in the Earth's crust as opposed to sunshine for energy. Oceanographers explore these surroundings to learn exactly how life can are present in such hostile conditions and the particular potential for identical ecosystems on additional planets. Estuaries represent another essential ecosystem where freshwater meets deep sea. These areas usually are vital for many marine species, portion as nurseries regarding fish and shellfish. They also offer a rich array of flower life, including mangroves and salt marshes, which play a crucial role inside water filtration and even habitat stability. Oceanographers investigate estuarine environments to understand their own significance in seaside health insurance and their role in mitigating the particular impacts of pollution and climate alter. Deep-Sea Discoveries Exploring the depths of the ocean unveils a realm of wonders as opposed to any on Globe. Oceanographers encounter an astonishing variety associated with deep-sea creatures, many of that are not really found somewhere else. Exclusive adaptations allow these species, such as the bioluminescent anglerfish and icon squid, to survive in complete darkness. The vibrant hues and unusual designs of these creatures often challenge our own understanding of existence, demonstrating the extraordinary diversity that exists in extreme environments. In addition to incredible marine life, oceanographers study geological features that reveal the history in our earth. Seafloor spreading, marine volcanoes, and hydrothermal vents present wonderful landscapes that condition ocean ecosystems. These types of environments are not only fascinating from a geological perspective, but they also support exclusive communities of living that depend on chemosynthesis rather than sun rays, showcasing the flexibility of life within the harshest conditions. Another deep aspect of deep-sea exploration is the particular study of environments affected by liveliness. Oceanographers meticulously file the impacts involving climate change, polluting of the environment, and overfishing on marine habitats. By simply analyzing these alterations, they gather essential information to support protect vulnerable types and advocate regarding sustainable practices. The deep sea will be a vital element of the global ecosystem, and comprehending its intricacies is definitely essential for conserving its wonders intended for future generations.

author: Bangkok Post Public Company Limited
title: Five tourists rescued from leaking tour boat off Phuket Bangkok Post Learning - Learn English from News
text:
Rescuers arrive on the scene where the tour boat Poseidon was leaking during a return trip from a diving excursion off Phuket on Wednesday evening. (Photo: Phuket Provincial Administration Organisation) Five foreign tourists were safely rescued from a tour boat that began leaking during a return trip from a diving excursion off Phuket.
Personnel from the Khaimuk Tourist Assistance Centre were sent to help the passengers stranded following a mechanical failure on the tour boat Poseidon at about 4.50pm on Wednesday.
A dive tour operator had alerted the centre that the boat‚Äôs exhaust pipe had malfunctioned , resulting in water leakage while en route between Koh Yao and Koh Khieo.
A rescue team was immediately sent to the scene and evacuated all five foreign tourists. All were safely transported back to Chalong Pier without injury.
Crew members from the Mermaid, which was also in the area, managed to stop the leak . The Poseidon was then towed back to shore by the Andaman Pearl 3 and Mermaid boats.
Vocabulary evacuate : to leave a place because it is not safe - ‡∏≠‡∏û‡∏¢‡∏û‡∏≠‡∏≠‡∏Å‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏û‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà exhaust (noun) : the waste gas from an engine, especially a car's, or the pipe the gas flows through - ‡∏Ñ‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ó‡πà‡∏≠‡πÑ‡∏≠‡πÄ‡∏™‡∏µ‡∏¢ failure : the fact of something not working or stopping working - leak : (of a liquid or gas) flowing out of a hole or crack - ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏£‡∏±‡πà‡∏ß‡πÑ‡∏´‡∏• malfunction (verb) : to fail to work or operate correctly - ‡∏ó‡∏≥‡∏á‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏ú‡∏¥‡∏î‡∏õ‡∏Å‡∏ï‡∏¥ mechanical : involving machinery or equipment that makes something operate, such as an engine - personnel : the people who are employed in a company, organization or one of the armed forces - ‡∏ö‡∏∏‡∏Ñ‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏£, ‡πÄ‡∏à‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏´‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà, ‡∏û‡∏ô‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏á‡∏≤‡∏ô pipe (noun) : a long tube used for carrying water, oil, gas, etc. from one place to another place - ‡∏ó‡πà‡∏≠ stranded : left somewhere with no way of going anywhere else - ‡∏õ‡∏•‡πà‡∏≠‡∏¢‡πÄ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏∞ ‡∏ñ‡∏π‡∏Å‡∏ó‡∏¥‡πâ‡∏á‡πÑ‡∏ß‡πâ tow : to pull a vehicle or boat by fixing it to the back of a another vehicle or boat - ‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏à‡∏π‡∏á

author: Muhammad Qasim
title: The Complete Guide to Stevia Leaf Extract: A Natural Sweetener for Health-Conscious Living
text:
In the search for healthier sugar alternatives, stevia leaf extract has emerged as a popular choice for those looking to cut down on calories without compromising on sweetness. Derived from the Stevia rebaudiana plant, this natural sweetener offers zero calories, is 200‚Äì300 times sweeter than sugar, and is packed with potential health benefits. This guide will cover everything you need to know about stevia leaf extract, including its origins, types, health benefits, uses, and how to safely incorporate it into your diet.
What is Stevia Leaf Extract?
Stevia leaf extract is a natural sweetener extracted from the leaves of the Stevia rebaudiana plant, native to South America. For centuries, indigenous communities in Paraguay and Brazil have used stevia leaves as a sweetener and herbal remedy. The sweet taste of stevia comes from compounds known as steviol glycosides , particularly rebaudioside A and stevioside, which are responsible for its intense sweetness without calories or a spike in blood sugar.
Commercial stevia leaf extract is usually produced by drying the stevia leaves, steeping them in water, and then refining the extract to isolate the steviol glycosides. This extraction process results in a highly concentrated, versatile sweetener that can be used in a wide range of foods and beverages.
Types of Stevia Leaf Extract
There are several forms of stevia available on the market, each with unique characteristics suited for different culinary applications:
Pure Stevia Extract : This is the most concentrated form, containing over 95% steviol glycosides. It‚Äôs extremely sweet, so only a tiny amount is needed to sweeten foods and beverages. Stevia Blends : Many stevia products are blended with other sweeteners like erythritol or monk fruit extract. These blends often have a more balanced taste profile, making them less likely to have the slight bitterness some people detect in pure stevia. They are also often easier to measure, resembling sugar in volume. Liquid Stevia : Liquid stevia is a convenient form of the extract, often used to sweeten beverages. It‚Äôs available in different flavors (like vanilla or chocolate) to add variety to drinks and desserts. Whole Leaf Powder : The least processed form, whole leaf stevia powder retains more of the plant‚Äôs natural components. While it‚Äôs a natural option, it is less refined than pure stevia extracts, often resulting in a greenish color and a slightly bitter aftertaste. Health Benefits of Stevia Leaf Extract
Qherb plant extract Stevia leaf extract provides numerous health benefits, making it a favorite among those looking to reduce sugar intake:
1. Calorie-Free Sweetness
One of the primary appeals of stevia leaf extract is that it offers sweetness without calories. This makes it a fantastic option for people on calorie-restricted diets, including those looking to lose weight or maintain their weight.
2. Helps Manage Blood Sugar Levels
Stevia is naturally non-glycemic, meaning it doesn‚Äôt raise blood sugar levels. Unlike regular sugar, stevia is not absorbed by the body in the same way, making it a safe option for people with diabetes or those aiming to stabilize their blood sugar levels.
3. Supports Oral Health
Sugar is a major contributor to cavities, but because stevia doesn‚Äôt promote the growth of bacteria that cause tooth decay, it‚Äôs a much better choice for maintaining oral health. It‚Äôs even used in some toothpastes and mouthwashes as a natural sweetener.
4. Antioxidant Properties
Stevia leaves contain antioxidants that help neutralize free radicals, which can protect cells from oxidative stress and may reduce the risk of chronic diseases.
5. May Improve Blood Pressure
Some research suggests that compounds in stevia may help relax blood vessels, reducing blood pressure. However, further studies are needed to confirm the long-term effects of stevia on blood pressure.
Uses of Stevia Leaf Extract
Stevia leaf extract can be used in various ways, both in cooking and everyday life:
1. Sweetening Beverages
Stevia is a popular addition to beverages like coffee, tea, smoothies, and lemonades. It provides a zero-calorie sweetness that works well in hot and cold drinks, though you may need to experiment with the amount to avoid an overly sweet taste.
2. Baking and Cooking
Stevia can be used in a range of recipes, including desserts, sauces, dressings, and marinades. However, because it doesn‚Äôt caramelize or add bulk like sugar, it‚Äôs best suited for recipes that don‚Äôt rely on sugar‚Äôs textural qualities. For baking, consider using a stevia blend specifically designed for baking, which often includes other ingredients to mimic the behavior of sugar.
3. Homemade Condiments
Stevia can be used to make healthier versions of condiments, such as ketchup, salad dressings, and syrups. Since these items often contain added sugars, substituting with stevia helps cut down on unnecessary calories.
4. Sugar Replacement in Snacks and Desserts
Use stevia in yogurt, oatmeal, pudding, or fruit salads for a healthy touch of sweetness. It‚Äôs also a good way to sweeten popsicles, ice cream, and other frozen treats.
Tips for Using Stevia Leaf Extract
While stevia leaf extract is an excellent sugar substitute, there are a few tips to help you get the best results:
Start Small : Stevia is much sweeter than sugar, so you only need a small amount. Start with a pinch or a few drops and adjust according to your taste. Experiment with Blends : If pure stevia tastes too intense or slightly bitter, consider using a stevia blend. These products often balance sweetness better and are easier to use in recipes that call for sugar. Be Mindful of Aftertaste : Some people detect a slight aftertaste with stevia, which can be more noticeable in higher amounts. Blending it with other ingredients can help minimize this aftertaste. Check Conversion Ratios : Since stevia is much sweeter than sugar, it‚Äôs essential to follow conversion guidelines. Most packaging provides a conversion chart, which can help you achieve the right sweetness. Combine with Other Sweeteners for Baking : When baking, you can combine stevia with other low-calorie sweeteners, like erythritol, to better replicate sugar‚Äôs texture and sweetness. Safety and Considerations
Stevia leaf extract is generally considered safe for consumption and is approved for use by health authorities in various countries. However, there are some considerations to keep in mind:
Allergic Reactions : Although rare, some individuals may have allergic reactions to stevia. If you experience any unusual symptoms after consuming it, consult a healthcare professional. Pregnancy and Breastfeeding : While stevia is generally considered safe, pregnant or breastfeeding women should consult their healthcare provider before adding any new sweeteners to their diet. Kidney Health : Because stevia contains compounds that act as diuretics, it may increase urination frequency. People with kidney issues should check with a doctor before using stevia regularly. Dosage : While stevia is safe for most people, consuming it in very high quantities could lead to mild gastrointestinal symptoms in some individuals. Stick to recommended servings for best results. Choosing the Best Stevia Leaf Extract
Not all stevia products are created equal. When shopping for stevia leaf extract, consider the following:
Purity : Look for products that contain 95% or higher steviol glycosides, as these are purer and have a more consistent sweetness. No Added Sugars : Some stevia products contain added sugars or fillers. Check the ingredient list to ensure you‚Äôre getting pure stevia or a blend with sugar-free alternatives. Certified Organic and Non-GMO : For those seeking the cleanest option, certified organic and non-GMO stevia products are widely available and meet high quality standards. Conclusion
Stevia leaf extract is a versatile, calorie-free sweetener that offers a range of benefits for health-conscious individuals. Its ability to provide natural sweetness without raising blood sugar makes it an excellent choice for people with diabetes, those looking to manage their weight, and anyone aiming to reduce their sugar intake. By understanding its types, health benefits, and best practices for use, you can enjoy the sweetness of stevia in a wide variety of recipes, from morning coffee to desserts.
With stevia leaf extract in your kitchen, you‚Äôll have a healthier, natural alternative that supports both your taste buds and wellness goals. Whether you‚Äôre a health enthusiast, a diabetic, or just looking to cut back on sugar, stevia can be a beneficial addition to your daily routine.

author: Hayley Peppin
title: Are the Matildas out of the Olympics now?
text:
The Matildas at Paris 2024: Olympic schedule and where to watch Our beloved national women‚Äôs football team defeated Zambia 6-5 in their nailbiting second Olympics match.
By Hayley Peppin and Dani Maher
INSTAGRAM / @MATILDAS WHILE YOU WERE sleeping, the Matildas won their second preliminary Olympics match against Zambia, in a game that came down to a nailbiting final half. The Australian national team‚Äôs 6-5 win in Nice comes as a welcome relief following their devastating 3-0 loss at the hands of Germany in Marseille last week.
Despite legendary player Sam Kerr unable to play this Olympic year due to an ACL injury, fans are optimistic about captain Steph Catley‚Äôs formidable side, with Catley herself, as well as forward Caitlin Foord and midfielder Katrina Gorry having all recovered from respective injuries just in time.
The most recent match saw the Matildas come back from a tense halftime, when they were trailing Zambia 2-4. But our underdogs rallied, with Michelle Heyman and Catley clawing back from behind to score four goals in a thrilling second half to win the match.
Earlier in Marseilles, Germany ‚Äî who are ranked No. 4 in the world ‚Äî were ruthless going forward, and perhaps could have scored more goals had the Matildas not leapt to defence. Need we remind fans that Australia also haven‚Äôt beaten Germany in almost two decades, so it was never going to be an easy first game. Now, the Tillies have one last preliminary match to show off their chops, and it won‚Äôt be an easy one, as they face off team USA, who knocked them into fourth place in Tokyo.
Below, we round up how you can cheer on the Matildas with upcoming games and where to watch them ‚Äî and what they‚Äôll need to do to earn a podium finish at the Olympics .
Related : Everything Australian viewers need to know about the Paris 2024 Olympic Games
INSTAGRAM / @MATILDAS When do the Matildas play at the Olympics? The Matildas‚Äô Olympics Games campaign kicked off on Thursday, July 25 at 7pm Paris time ‚Äî ahead of the Paris 2024 Olympic Opening Ceremony on July 26.
With a 3-0 loss to heavyweights Germany in Marseille, captain Steph Catley told media the girls ‚Äúneed to be better.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt was definitely a wake-up call. We have two more games and we have to turn it around quickly. We have a lot to learn from here. I think at times we were well on top and let two set pieces affect the game in a very negative way. There are things that we can fix nice and quickly, which is good. But we just need to be better.‚Äù
Catley continued by saying the Matildas need to learn from their preliminary game mistakes, as they continue their Olympics campaign. ‚ÄúThey are a good team. We did it to ourselves in the end. We conceded two set pieces. We are usually much, much better on set pieces. It is a wake-up call and it is not to our standard and we need to be better for the next game and turn in this tournament around.‚Äù
Related : Ellie Carpenter: On a mission
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Matildas (@matildas)
When are the Matildas next games at the Olympics? The Matildas have one more preliminary Paris 2024 match, facing the USA (ranked fifth) on Thursday, August 1. Their game is at 7pm Paris time, which falls in the devastatingly early hours of the morning for us at 3am AEST.
When are the football finals at the Olympics? If the Matildas qualify (crossing our fingers and toes!) they‚Äôll be up for the following rounds:
Saturday‚ÄîSunday, August 3-4: Quarter-finals Tuesday, August 7: Semi-finals Friday, August 9: Bronze medal match Sunday, August 11: Gold medal match
How to watch the Matildas 2024 Olympics matches You‚Äôll be able to tune into all the Matildas action via the Nine Network, which this year holds the Olympics broadcasting rights. You‚Äôll be able to watch each of their games live and free (if you‚Äôre so inclined for that 3am wake-up) on more than 40 of Nine‚Äôs free-to-air channels. If you prefer a sleep-in, you can catch up on highlights via the broadcaster‚Äôs 9Now streaming platform.
For the first time, local streamer Stan will also broadcast the Olympics ‚Äî all games, ad-free, live and on-demand.
And if you prefer to watch the games away from home, there‚Äôs a slew of venues and public spaces across the country showcasing the games ‚Äî from Federation Square in Melbourne‚Äôs CBD to The Tumbalong Park Sound Shell at Darling Harbour in Sydney.
Related : A psychologist explains why the Matildas have suddenly awoken your inner sports fan
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Matildas (@matildas)
What are the Matildas ranked in the world? According to the most recent FIFA Women‚Äôs World Ranking, the Matildas are currently ranked 12th in the world. World No. 1 goes to Spain, with France in second place, England in third and Germany in fourth.
Have the Matildas ever won an Olympic medal before? The Matildas haven‚Äôt secured a Olympic medal before ‚Äî but they did come close at the last Olympics. At Tokyo 2021, the girls just lost the bronze medal to USA, earning a fourth place position.
Related : The CommBank Matildas suit up in local label BEARE PARK before playing to a record home crowd in Sydney

title: #164 Valencianos explotan contra una nueva actividad para turistas en la que recorren la ciudad bailando
text:

Ocupan bastante espacio p√∫blico y como actividad tur√≠stica no tiene micho sentido, pero claro, en el tiempo en que nos ha tocado vivir donde hay que presumir de hacer algo "distinto" y por supuesto colgarlo/comentarlo en las redes sociales...

Si tus hijos juegan con un bal√≥n en el parque - Molestan a los ancianitos que le dan de comer a las palomas...

[#116](c116#c-116) > porque los dem√°s tambi√©n aguantar√°n TUS ESTUPIDECES
No. Por lo general, al estar dotado de dignidad, evito hacer estupideces en p√∫blico.
> Si vas a cenar a una terraza - Molestas a los vecinos que se levantan a las 5AM
Si ceno en un restaurante evito las terrazas. Paso de aguantar el humo ajeno, ruido de tr√°fico, cucarachas y contenedores de la basura a dos pasos.
> Si tus hijos juegan con un bal√≥n en el parque - Molestan a los ancianitos que le dan de comer a las palomas...
¬øMe est√°s comparando estos "adultos" con ni√±os de unos pocos a√±os? Te lo compro. No dan para m√°s.
> Si no sois capaces de aguantar nada iros a vivir al campo o como ermita√±os.
Que se vaya a vivir al campo el que molesta, no el que intenta vivir tranquilo.
[#69](c69#c-69) Primero los ciclistas, luego los patinetes, ahora los turistas con cascos el gran problema de seguridad vial.
[#64](c64#c-64) hasta que quieres salir del portal y te encuentras a 15 monguers caminando a ritmo de Thriller (tres pasitos, manos. Tres pasitos, manos)...
[#1](c1#c-1) Tambi√©n te digo una cosa, entre estos y las despedidas de soltero/a con esc√°ndalos impresionantes a cualquier hora me quedo con lo primero.
Lo que si me parece de c√°rcel es el "uniforme" que le han puesto a los gu√≠as, un cruce entre un lim√≥n y el chavo del ocho
[#49](c49#c-49) El otro d√≠a en el trabajo un americano me pregunt√≥: "¬ø A d√≥nde va un Espa√±ol cuando quiere ir de vacaciones? "
Me cago en los muertos de catetos y caciques que han apostado fuertesimo al turismo.
[#155](c155#c-155) Si veis como algo positivo que seamos el resort de occidente, que de puertas para afuera solo somos turismo, pues fale üòÄ
A ver la frase fue mas bien "A donde vas de vacaciones cuando vives en Espa√±a"
[#157](c157#c-157) pues ya te digo, desde la distancia y sin conoceros ni a tu compa√±ero ni a ti, me parece un pregunta fruto de la curiosidad.
[#4](c4#c-4)
Resumir la avalancha de turismo que se sufre en muchas capitales de √©ste pa√≠s diciendo que les molesta que la gente se lo pase bien es demagogia nivel dios.
Todo tiene un l√≠mite, las ciudades tambi√©n, y en muchas est√°n superando el l√≠mite de convivencia y de capacidad para que una ciudad siga siendo y funcionando para que sus habitantes vivan.
Se tomar√°n medidas contra √©sta locura, no lo dudo, porque es un problema que crece al mismo ritmo que la mala educaci√≥n de la gente.
Esta cr√≠tica refleja el sentimiento de una parte de la poblaci√≥n que se siente marginada en su propia ciudad, desplazada por actividades que, aunque novedosas y atractivas para los visitantes, alteran la vida cotidiana de los residentes.
La controversia en torno a Bailaloloco Silent Disco Tour es solo un ejemplo m√°s del complejo equilibrio que Valencia intenta mantener entre el desarrollo tur√≠stico y la preservaci√≥n de su identidad y calidad de vida para sus habitantes.
Suena a ChatGPT.
[#20](c20#c-20) Ingresos para qui√©n y c√≥mo? Cada actividad humana tiene diferentes externalidades negativas, en el caso del turismo las estamos viendo ahora y estamos decidiendo si las queremos o no.
[#1](c1#c-1) No estoy en contra, quiz√°s deben limitar el n√∫mero de asistentes para que no molesten tanto. Se ve que el grupo es bastante grande.
¬ø"Los valencianos explotan"?, ¬øcu√°ntos valencianos?, porque en la no-noticia recopila 3 opiniones de internet, y ya est√°.
[#141](c141#c-141) Creo que incluso puede ser un publireportaje, que en estos tiempos de SEO agresivo nunca se sabe, y aparece el nombre de la empresa y el precio del servicio
Se ha vendido el pa√≠s (su arquitectura, paisajes, hasta las casas mismas...) y los beneficios han ido a cuatro empresarios hoteleros. Muerte a este modelo!!!
[#20](c20#c-20) Amen por esa ultima frase.
A mi el turismo solo me quita capacidad de consumo.
Que si, que los hosteleros pagan impuestos. Pero en Valencia ya no puedo tomarme una birra por 1,5‚Ç¨, y alwuilar una casa ni te cuento.
El ser humano cuando se convierte en turista est√° demostrado que se vuelve (o nos volvemos, no quiero ser m√°s que nadie) gilipollas, bailar por la calle como un poseso, ir por el centro de la calle para hacerte fotos(salir de casa te pone la armadura de Ironman, si te atropella un üöï no duele), beber sin control....
[#123](c123#c-123) para empezar usan la v√≠a p√∫blica para dar un servicio que bloquea e invade con ruido y espacio.
No es muy diferente que un a terraza delante de un bar. Solo que estas mierdas son m√≥viles.
Luego, y esto ya es m√°s subjetivo, est√° en disonancia con una visita tur√≠stica.
Una cosa es una visita tur√≠stica y otra hacer deporte y baile. Las dos ala vez es un sinsentido. Que te gusta ver a gente haciendo el canelo? Perfecto. A m√≠ me disgusta y me fuerza a no estar cerca, porque me produce rechazo y verg√ºenza. Adem√°s de ser una afrenta al patrimonio de una ciudad, hacer una visita haciendo el tolai.

author: Elizabeth Kalaijian
title: Marion‚Äôs Sippican School Students to Participate in Grow Education Farm-to-School Program for the Second Year
text:
MARION ‚Äî Superintendent Michael S. Nelson is pleased to announce that Sippican Elementary School has partnered with the Marion Institute to participate in the Grow Education Farm-to-School (Grow FTS) program for the second year in a row.
‚ÄúWe are very happy to partner for another year with the Marion Institute to offer this program to students,‚Äù said Superintendent Nelson. ‚ÄúOur students and staff enjoyed the first year, discovering new healthy habits and learning from Grow FTS leaders. They had many fun and hands-on educational experiences while beautifying the Sippican School grounds.‚Äù
The Marion Institute‚Äôs Grow FTS program works within school districts to build a more equitable food system that promotes ecological literacy, health and sustainability. It supports teachers, engages families and educates students in creating healthier eating and living habits. This program currently partners with 23 regional elementary schools, serving students and staff in grades three and four in four school districts.
Grow FTS and the Sippican School are working together to provide another year of positive learning experiences for students.
Year two consists of much of the same programming as the previous year, including outdoor classroom activities and providing a curriculum that directly correlates with classroom lessons and professional development for staff members. This year, the Grow FTS program will reinforce the importance of nutrition, healthy eating and living habits more intensely. Additionally, the Marion Institute recently partnered with AmeriCorps staff to place a FoodCorps member in the school at least twice a week to directly oversee the lessons embedded into the classroom, the cafeteria and the community.
During the first Grow FTS, Sippican Elementary School‚Äôs third-grade students and teachers were supported by Nate Sander, the Marion Institute‚Äôs Grow Education Program Manager, for outdoor garden lessons throughout the school year. Students learned about science while beautifying their school by planting a variety of fast growing crops in Sippican‚Äôs newly-built raised gardening beds. They learned how the sun and soil work together to produce an environment conducive for plants to grow and thrive.
‚ÄúWe are thrilled to be working with the Sippican Elementary School again,‚Äù said Marion Institute Executive Director Liz Wiley. ‚ÄúThe students, teachers and administration have all been so supportive and welcoming. Sippican was the site of our very first Grow Education garden. Since then, our program has expanded to include year-round farm-to-school lessons that utilize the gardens as outdoor classrooms that excite and engage students to learn more about where their food comes from, how it is grown and why making healthy food choices matter to their bodies and the environments.‚Äù
Throughout the program‚Äôs first year, third-graders and staff members attended ‚Äúvirtual field trips‚Äù and heard from guest speakers involved in the program during the winter months. Sippican students conducted a butterfly study and spring planting, as well as a harvest workshop and a planting workshop this summer.
About the Grow Education Program
The Marion Institute launched Grow Education Farm-to-School (Grow FTS) programming to support teachers, engage families and educate students in creating healthier eating and living habits. The Marion Institute works in partnership with school districts to build a more equitable food system that promotes ecological literacy, health and sustainability while covering the plant life-cycle curriculum. The Grow FTS program has partnered with many school districts including New Bedford and Westport, Wareham and Old Rochester Regional School District.
###
